page.title: 13MELDON RESERVOIR 2
page.content: The reservoir holds 3.75million cubic metres of water, being 1320m long and up to 44.4m deep. The water flows off the high moor into the reservoir. When full the overflow water flows through the spillways down the 44m dam in a foaming cascade. At other times the river flow is maintained by water passing through the outlet channel at the base of the dam. At times of low river flow water is pumped from the reservoir to the treatment plant at Prewley about 1.5km away, before going into the South West Water's mains. The reservoir has a reliable yield of 227000 cubic metres of water per day. This is very important in an area which often suffers from hot dry summers and therefore water shortages. Dartmoor lost a beautiful valley when the dam was built, but gained a lake for fishing and windsurfing.
